FRS_Method: GPS CARRIER PHASE STATIC RELATIVE POSITION

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Tuscan Dairy manufactures fluid milk and beverage products at our plant in Unon.  We have a strong commitment to operate our facility in a safe and responsible manner.

Ammonia is used at our facility as the cooling medium in our refrigeration system.  Similar to the function freon plays in a home or car air conditioning system, ammonia is used to cool the air in our product chillers and refrigerated coolers.  The ammonia is contained in a closed loop system; it is designed to remain inside the piping and vessels in our facility.  We believe that ammonia provides the safest and most efficient cooling choice for our operation.

A.  Describe the Accident Release  Prevention and Emergency Policies

Tuscan Dairy takes many precautions to prevent or minimize accidental releases of ammonia from the refrigeration system.  These precautions include safety controls (alarms and automatic shutdown devices) which are designed to identify and prevent potentially unsafe conditions like pressure increases that could cause a system failure.  We also have a preventative maintenance program designed to maintain the on-going integrity of the systems, a training program designed to ensure that the systems are operated by qualified personnel, and to respond quickly to system upsets.

The Plant Engineer is responsible for the management of these ammonia safety systems.

B.  Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled

The facility operates a refrigeration sytem with ammonia as the only substance covered by the Accidental Release Prevention Regulations handled at the Union plant.

C.  Summary of Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios

EPA requires us to define the worst case release scenario from the Union plant as the release of all the ammonia from the largest vessel on site, the main ammonia reciever.  EPA also requires us to assume the the weather conditions are such that there is almost no wind and no mixing in the atomsphere.

The alternative release scenario at the Uni

on plant would involve the release of ammonia over a 10-minute period due the the rupture of a 1/2" high-pressure liquid line.  The duration of the release was estimated for the alternative release scenario by estimating the amouunt of time required to stop the leak.  Again, EPA required us to estimate the impacts of this release under low wind and stable weather conditions.

Both of these releases are unlikely for many reasons.  Our equipment and system were designed using industry standards for ammonia refrigeration.  We have taken precautions to protect our equipment for obvious threats, like vehicular traffic.  We have a preventive maintenance program to maintain the on-going integrity of the refrigeration equipment.  Training programs are in place to ensure that qualified personnel operate the systems, and our emergency response procedures allow us to respond quickly in the event of an accident.  And lastly, the weather conditions used in estimating the extent of the releases are uncommon.

D.  Description of the Accidental Release Preventation Program

The facility has an accident release prevention program that complies with the Occupational Safety and Health Act's Process Safety Management Standard and EPA's Risk Management Program Regulation.  The prevention program consists of the following elements:

-  Employee Participation Program
-  Process Safety Information
-  Process Hazard Analysis
-  Operating Procedures
-  Training Program
-  Contractor Safety Program
-  Pre-Startup Safety Review Procedures
-  Mechanical Integrity Programs
-  Hot Work Permit Procedures
-  Management of Change Procedures
-  Incident Investigation Procedures
-  Compliance Audit Procedures

E.  Five Year Accident History

The have been no ammonia-related accidents at the Union plant in the past five years.

F.  Description of the Emergency Response Program

An emergency response program has been implemented at the Union plant.  This program contains procedures describing how the fa

cility will respond to ammonia  spills and other emergencies, including evacuation procedures  The plant response team utilizes employess who are trained to enter and stop an accidental ammonia release.

G.  Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Tuscan Dairy is committed to operating our ammonia refrigeration sytem in a safe and responsibe manner.  We are continually evaluating our equipment and procedures to meet this objective.  Planned improvements include computer control upgrade.

Tuscan Dairy has tested and proven that its ammonia equipment is Y2K compliant.
